what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal bbsTaiwan streamline Taiwan Breeding Birds Survey (BBS) data retrieval analysis. support data retrieval GBIF, Taiwan BBS data stored. ‘bbsTrim’ also include population trend modelling. Users can tailor species analysis, controlling data stratification, preparation, modeling. goal expand Taiwan BBS data access broader R-society Taiwan.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install load development version bbsTaiwan GitHub :

what: If you need raw Taiwan BBS dataset on GBIF:
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Taiwan BBS raw data can accessed directly typing object name: complete Taiwan BBS dataset GBIF following Darwin Core Archive (DwC - ) format: Occurrence: lists set times locations particular species recorded Event: lists includes protocols used, sample size, location Measurement Facts: includes additional information relating events Extended Measurement Fact: includes additional information relating taxon occurrences

what: bbsTaiwan also provide a workflow to process Taiwan BBS data:
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows use package: Check distribution BBS sites number sites surveyed throughout years:  Look scientific name species interest Fetch data species interest. need dataset across species, leave argument target_species NULL. output bbs_fetch list two elements: occurrence site_info. occurrence tibble, showing observations target species within selected year range second element site_info tibble including BBS sites: function bbs_fetch can also take multiple species time: View distribution occurrence target species within selected year range  Get basic summary statistics fetched data
code: bbs_history() #> NULL bbs_translate(c("白頭翁", "烏頭翁", "台灣噪眉")) #> [1] "Pycnonotus sinensis"          "Pycnonotus taivanus"          #> [3] "Trochalopteron morrisonianum" x <- bbs_fetch(target_species = bbs_translate("火冠戴菊鳥")) #> Joining with `by = join_by(locationID)` x$occurrence #> # A tibble: 3,109 × 15 #>     year month   day locationID eventID       weather wind  habitat occurrenceID #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <chr>         <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>        #>  1  2009     4    19 B14-01_10  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:B4:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  2  2009     6     7 B13-01_06  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  3  2009     6    25 B13-01_06  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  4  2009     5    26 B13-01_05  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  5  2009     6     7 B13-01_05  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  6  2009     5    26 B13-01_03  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  7  2009     6     7 B13-01_03  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  8  2009     6    25 B13-01_01  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A3:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #>  9  2009     6     7 B13-01_07  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A2:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #> 10  2009     5    29 B13-01_08  TWBBS_2009_B… <NA>    <NA>  A2:C5:… TWBBS_2009_… #> # ℹ 3,099 more rows #> # ℹ 6 more variables: scientificName <chr>, vernacularName <chr>, #> #   individualCount <dbl>, time_slot <chr>, distance <chr>, flock <chr> x$site_info #> # A tibble: 4,160 × 9 #>    site  plot  locationID locality decimalLatitude decimalLongitude  elev region #>    <chr> <chr> <chr>      <chr>              <dbl>            <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  #>  1 A02-… 01    A02-01_01  台北縣…             25.1             122.  109. North  #>  2 A02-… 02    A02-01_02  台北縣…             25.1             122.  105. North  #>  3 A02-… 03    A02-01_03  台北縣…             25.1             122.  105. North  #>  4 A02-… 04    A02-01_04  台北縣…             25.1             122.  105. North  #>  5 A02-… 05    A02-01_05  台北縣…             25.1             122.  105. North  #>  6 A02-… 06    A02-01_06  台北縣…             25.1             122.  105. North  #>  7 A02-… 07    A02-01_07  台北縣…             25.1             122.  105. North  #>  8 A02-… 08    A02-01_08  台北縣…             25.1             122.  105. North  #>  9 A02-… 09    A02-01_09  台北縣…             25.1             122.  154. North  #> 10 A02-… 10    A02-01_10  台北縣…             25.1             122.  154. North  #> # ℹ 4,150 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: zone <chr> x <- bbs_fetch(bbs_translate(c("烏頭翁", "白頭翁"))) #> Joining with `by = join_by(locationID)` bbs_plotmap(x) bbs_stat(x) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #> # Groups:   vernacularName, scientificName [2] #>   vernacularName scientificName       East Mountain  West North Total #>   <chr>          <chr>               <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 烏頭翁         Pycnonotus taivanus  0.92     0.03  0.02  0     0.11 #> 2 白頭翁         Pycnonotus sinensis  0.14     0.25  0.96  0.98  0.78

code: bbs_poptrend(data = bbs_fetch(bbs_translate("金背鳩"))) #> Joining with `by = join_by(locationID)` #> Estimated percent change from year = 2009 to 2016: -5.8% (-29%, 27%)  #> NULL
